title: Here‚Äôs Who‚Äôs Performing a Tribute to Ozzy Osbourne at 2025 MTV¬†VMAs
summary: The network announced an all-star line-up for the homage slated to take place during Sunday's (Sept. 7) broadcast.
body: The Prince of Darkness will have another moment in the light on Sunday (Sept. 7) when some of Ozzy Osbourne ‘s musical compatriots and biggest fans will take the stage to honor the late metal legend at the 2025 MTV VMAs. According to a release announcing the special tribute, Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler and guitarist Joe Perry will join Yungblud and Extreme’s Nuno Bettencourt during this year’s awards broadcast, which will air live on CBS beginning at 8 p.m. ET. Related Jack Osbourne Reveals How He Found Out Dad Ozzy Osbourne Died: ‘I Just Knew Something Bad Had Happened’ Jack Osbourne Trashes ‘Pathetic and Out of Touch’ Roger Waters Over Ozzy Osbourne Diss: ‘F–k You’ Justin Bieber Doubles Down on 'Swag II': Stream It Now The rockers will take the stage to honor the Prince of Darkness with a medley of his greatest hits on the program that will be hosted by LL Cool J. In addition to being one of the most beloved figures in hard rock, Osbourne also had a storied history with MTV, from appearing on Headbanger’s Ball in the 1980s to sharing his private life with the world on the wildly popular family rea‚Ä¶

title: Love the Pixel 10? You can now wear it on your sleeve, almost literally
summary: After Pixel Drop, it's time for some merch drop!
body: Credit: Google Google has launched new Pixel 10-themed merchandise. The T-Shirt, ceramic mug, and a roll of washi tape, all come with a coded message. Besides online, Google will also sell these items in its physical stores across the US. Google has just dropped a new set of merchandise in succession of the Pixel 10 series phones announced last month. The newly added products include a coffee mug, a full-sleeve T-shirt, and a roll of washi tape. All of these products are available in black and have a series of binary numbers printed on them. I asked Google Lens to scan and interpret these numbers for me, and I was informed that it reads ‚Äú72 101 108 111 33‚Äù in decimal digits. Without me asking, the built-in AI also interpreted that these numbers represented the positions of various English alphabet letters in the list of ASCII characters, so I didn‚Äôt have to use my own brain cells trying to decode them.

title: Gemini‚Äôs coming, but are you dreading the big Google Home speaker shakeup?
summary: We want to hear from you. Are you welcoming or dreading the major Google speaker shakeup?
body: This is an open thread. We want to hear from you! Share your thoughts in the comments and vote in the poll below ‚Äî your take might be featured in a future roundup.

title: The Galaxy Tab S11 family is here, but should you upgrade from your older Galaxy tablet?
summary: It's not about how old your existing tablet is, but whether or not the Galaxy Tab S11 will provide a meaningful upgrade.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority While many of us still upgrade smartphones every 2‚Äì4 years on average, tablets tend to have a much longer shelf life. They‚Äôre typically used less often and for narrower purposes like video consumption or light productivity. With the arrival of the Galaxy Tab S11 and Tab S11 Ultra , you might be wondering whether now is finally the right time to replace your aging Galaxy tablet. The answer here isn‚Äôt so cut and dry. It‚Äôs really less about age and more about whether the new models deliver a meaningful improvement to your existing experience. Let‚Äôs dive in a bit deeper and take a look at some of the past models to get a better idea of whether an upgrade is right for you.

title: Police Say Former Mastodon Guitarist Brent Hinds Was at Fault in Deadly Motorcycle¬†Crash
summary: Hinds died on Aug. 20 in Atlanta when his Harley collided with a BMW SUV.
body: Atlanta police said that Mastodon co-founder Brent Hinds, 51, was at fault in the motorcycle crash that took his life on the night of Aug. 20. According to Atlanta New First , the details are in contrast to the initial findings in the investigation that put the fault on the 22-year-old driver of the BMW SUV that Hinds crashed into for allegedly failing to yield at an intersection. Related Mastodon Pays Tribute to Brent Hinds at First Show Since Guitarist’s Death: ‘Brothers to the End’ Justin Bieber Doubles Down on 'Swag II': Stream It Now Tones And I Will Perform At 2025 NBA Series In Melbourne The updated police report on the incident involving the former Mastodon guitarist said that, “After conducting time distance calculations of the Motorcycle and assessing the changes in velocity of the BMW it was deemed that Hinds was traveling between 63 and 68 mph. Video of the intersection was used for the calculations. The video clearly depicts the crash. Hinds was at fault for the crash.‚Äù Hinds’ speed at the time of the deadly accident was reportedly twice the speed limit at the crash site, with two eyewitnesses telling the police that the gu‚Ä¶

title: Kelly Clarkson Returns to Instagram After Former Husband‚Äôs Death With Sentimental ‚ÄòIdol‚Äô Post: ‚ÄòIt Is a Gift to Find Your¬†Purpose‚Äô
summary: The singer had been off her socials since ex Brandon Blackstock's death last month.
body: Kelly Clarkson returned to Instagram on Thursday (Sept. 4) for the first time since the death of her ex-husband Brandon Blackstock last month. In a sentimental post tied to the 23rd anniversary of her life-changing American Idol win on Sept. 4, 2022 that capped the iconic music competition’s first season, Clarkson gave thanks for the moment that changed everything. Related Here’s When ‘The Kelly Clarkson Show’ Will Return for New Episodes (And New Kellyoke Covers) Old Dominion Says Kenny Chesney 'Definitely Is Deserving' of Country Music Hall of Fame Honor Ahead of 'Swag II,' Justin Bieber Scores His First Music Video With 4 Billion Views on YouTube “To everyone that took time 23 years ago to call in and vote for me, thank you üôè Winning American Idol changed my life and I will be forever grateful for all of you that have supported me for so many years,” Clarkson wrote alongside a photo of her being embraced by her cast mates in the midst of a confetti tsunami. “It is a gift to find your purpose and passion, and to be able to make a living doing it is the cherry on top. Thank you, always.” After coming out on‚Ä¶

title: Nothing Ear (3), the company‚Äôs fourth-generation earbuds, are launching ‚Äòsoon‚Äô
summary: Nothing has just confirmed that it will soon be launching Nothing Ear (3), its fourth-generation earbuds, are launching ‚Äúsoon.‚Äù more‚Ä¶

title: The first Snapdragon 8 Elite handheld has an unbelievably low price, but only if you act fast
summary: The AYN Odin 3 launches this weekend, and prices are much lower than expected.
body: Credit: AYN The AYN Odin 3 will start at $299 for the first 48 hours of the Indiegogo campaign. Retail pricing starts at $349, with the 24+1TB version maxing out at $549. The campaign launches on September 7 at 9:30 AM CST. Right in time for the weekend, AYN has finally announced pricing on its upcoming Odin 3 handheld. A clear upgrade over the Odin 2, it‚Äôs the first handheld to officially feature a Snapdragon 8 Elite, and it‚Äôs significantly cheaper than expected. Pricing for the Odin 3 starts at $299 for the base 8+128GB model, jumping up to $499 for the maxed-out 24+1TB model. However, there‚Äôs a catch. Those are the ‚ÄúSuper Early Bird‚Äù prices, and they‚Äôre only valid for the first 48 hours of the Indiegogo campaign.

title: Survey reveals a close battle for best Pixel 10 Pro alternative
summary: Readers voted for the OnePlus 13 as the top Pixel 10 Pro alternative, narrowly beating the Galaxy S25.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Google launched the Pixel 10 series last month, and the Pixel 10 Pro continues the trend of offering great camera hardware in a pocket-friendly design. Otherwise, it offers plenty of AI features, a relatively large battery, and seven years of updates. Colleague Joe Maring recently looked at some alternative phones to the Pixel 10 Pro. He also included a poll asking for your favorite alternative phone. Well, the results are in, and here‚Äôs what you told us.

title: I tested the Pixel 10‚Äôs charging with Google‚Äôs own 67W brick, and it‚Äôs still disappointingly slow
summary: Google seems worried about Pixel 10 battery temperatures.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Google‚Äôs Pixel series has, to be blunt, always been pretty slow to charge. Even the Pixel 9 Pro XL‚Äôs boost to 37W (about 35W effective) still left the phone taking a sluggish 77 minutes to reach full, while the regular 26W capabilities of the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro left last year‚Äôs users waiting about 85 minutes. Nothing has changed for the better with the new Pixel 10 series . In fact, after testing Google‚Äôs latest flagships with the company‚Äôs new 67W USB-C charger , the situation is in some ways worse than before. I‚Äôll let the graphs do the talking.

title: Solid-state power banks are ready to keep you juiced ‚Äî without burning all your stuff
summary: BMX's new SolidSafe battery packs deliver both wireless convenience and unparalleled damage resistance.
body: BMX is bringing solid-state tech to battery packs with a 5,000mAh and 10,000mAh solution. Solid-state construction allows these batteries to take serious damage and keep right on running. Magnetic Qi charging also makes them perfect for pairing with a new Pixel 10. Lithium-ion batteries have been an utter game-changer for mobile devices, making possible everything from our smartphones to practical electric cars. But for all the power they can offer, their construction comes at a perilous disadvantage: It‚Äôs far too easy to damage one, and that risks the battery becoming a serious fire hazard. One of the best solutions we‚Äôve come up with for fixing that problem is replacing the liquid electrolyte that mobilizes the charge in these cells with a mostly solid alternative: so-called solid-state batteries . Not only does that kind of design improve power density (so smaller batteries can hold more charge), but it also wildly improves durability ‚Äî and resistance to catastrophic failure.

title: Travis Kelce Jokes About the Biggest Change in His Life Since Taylor Swift Engagement: ‚ÄòI Got One More Ring For¬†It‚Äô
summary: Trav's QB, Patrick Mahomes, also told Brazilian media that they need to update their references to the pop star now that she's betrothed.
body: As we’ve learned from watching the New Heights podcast, Travis Kelce ‘s got jokes. Which is why it was no surprise when the Kansas City Chiefs’ three-time Super Bowl champ had a pithy quip when asked by reporters on Thursday (Sept. 4) to describe the biggest change in his life since recently getting engaged to longtime love Taylor Swift . Related NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell Reveals Whether Taylor Swift Is in the Mix For 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Justin Bieber Doubles Down on 'Swag II': Stream It Now Travis Kelce Talks Proposing to Taylor Swift for the ‘Right Reasons,’ Says Calling Her His ‘Fianc√©e’ Makes Him ‘Giddy’ “I got one more ring for it, two if we’re counting the first Super Bowl, ” Kelce said at a news conference in S√£o Paulo, Brazil in advance of the Chiefs’ season kick-off game against the Los Angeles Chargers, according to the Associated Press . “I would say ever since I’ve been dating Taylor, life has been fun.” And though he did not bite on a question about whether Swift was going to be in the house at Corinthians Arena for Friday night’s (Sept. 5) ga‚Ä¶

title: Everyone‚Äôs in awe of ‚Äòtri-fold‚Äô phones, and now projectors are all ‚Äòyeah, us, too‚Äô
summary: The Aurzen ZIP brings foldable design to projectors to deliver new viewing options and enhance portability.
body: The Aurzen ZIP projector has a Z-shaped folding design that collapses to just one inch thick. A 5,000 mAh battery delivers 90 minutes of operation on a charge. In addition to the folding design letting you easily direct the ZIP‚Äôs output, you can turn it on its side for screen-mirroring portrait mode. Listen, foldables are cool ‚Äî who doesn‚Äôt love big things that transform into smaller things ‚Äî but they‚Äôre also becoming a little been-there-done-that as manufacturers really start getting comfortable with the form factor. And that sort of familiarity is probably exactly why so many of us have been shifting our interests slightly towards the growing crop of ‚Äútri-fold‚Äù devices like Samsung‚Äôs upcoming TriFold or the new Mate XTs . Editor‚Äôs note: When did the mobile industry forget how to count? All these things fold twice , not three times. Get it together.

title: Google leaks its new Nest Cams and Nest Doorbell inside the Home app
summary: The new Nest devices could feature a better camera and new Gemini-powered features.
body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority Images and mentions of the upcoming Nest Cam Indoor, Nest Cam Outdoor, and Nest Doorbell have been spotted in the latest Google Home app update. Previous leaks suggest all the devices could feature 2K video recording, digital zoom up to 6x with Zoom and Crop, support for Gemini, and come in multiple color options. Google is preparing to launch some new Nest-branded products. The company sneakily teased a new Gemini-equipped Nest speaker at the Pixel 10 ‚Äòs launch event. Thanks to a leak, we‚Äôve also gotten a look at new Nest-branded cameras and a doorbell . We‚Äôve now spotted more images of the Nest Cam and Nest Doorbell, and they come straight from Google itself. We‚Äôve spotted mentions of Google‚Äôs upcoming Nest devices within the latest version of the Google Home app.

title: 5 reasons I‚Äôd buy the Galaxy Tab S11 over the S11 Ultra
summary: The Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra is undoubtedly a pro-grade upgrade, but the standard Tab S11 is the better fit for most people.
body: It‚Äôs that time of the year when Samsung updates its premium tablet lineup alongside launching a new FE phone . The Galaxy Tab S11 series is out now , but this time it looks a little different. There‚Äôs no Plus or Pro model to speak of ‚Äî just the standard Galaxy Tab S11 and its uber-packed, equally uber-expensive Ultra sibling. The Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra does give you a few extras besides that massive screen, but if you ask me, I‚Äôd stick with the standard model. Here‚Äôs why.

title: Galaxy Z Fold 7 continues to be a hit, with a production boost needed to meet demand
summary: After a few generations faltering, Samsung‚Äôs new Galaxy Z Fold 7 seems like a smash hit, with a new report revealing that Samsung is already needing to boost production just to keep up with demand. more‚Ä¶

title: The first Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 phones could have ridiculously big batteries
summary: The Xiaomi 16 series will be the first next-gen Snapdragon-powered phones, and a leak reveals stupendously large batteries.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority A new Xiaomi 16 series leak suggests major battery upgrades across the board. This varies from 7,000mAh for the compact Xiaomi 16 all the way to 7,500mAh for the purported Xiaomi 16 Pro Max. These will be the first phones with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 (or Gen 2) processors. Xiaomi will be the first Android brand to offer phones with the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 (or Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 2) processor. However, it looks like all three of these upcoming phones could bring impressive batteries. Leaker Yogesh Brar has claimed on Twitter that three Xiaomi 16 series phones are coming, namely the Xiaomi 16, the Xiaomi 16 Pro, and the Xiaomi 16 Pro Max. Furthermore, the tipster says the standard model will have a 7,000mAh battery, the Pro model will have a 6,300mAh battery, and the Pro Max model will top out at 7,500mAh.

title: 7 features I‚Äôm excited to try when Gemini lands on my Google Home speakers
summary: Gemini is more versatile, more powerful, and more suited for use around the house than Assistant ever was.
body: Credit: Adam Molina / Android Authority Gemini support on Google Home and Nest speakers has been a long time coming. The feature has been in preview testing for some lucky US users with specific voices for months now, but Google just announced the exact date when it‚Äôll start showing up for real : October 1. Although this will still be an early access, I can‚Äôt wait to get my proverbial hands on it because I‚Äôm sick of Google Assistant‚Äôs glitches . The inconsistency, frequent bugs, and silly downgrades have taken the joy out of using a ‚Äúsmart‚Äù speaker, to a point where I find myself arguing with it more often than using it. Gemini, however, has been a lot more interesting to use on my Pixel phones and watches, and I can‚Äôt help but think that this will be a huge upgrade for everyone. Here‚Äôs why.

title: Justin Bieber‚Äôs ‚ÄòSwag II‚Äô: All 23 Tracks¬†Ranked
summary: Billboard sizes up the 23 new songs on Bieber's semi-surprise sequel set.
body: Swag, swag, swag… on II . The suddenly very prolific pop superstar Justin Bieber announced over social media on Thursday (Sept. 4) that midnight would bring with it the surprise sequel to his equally unexpected Swag album from July. Midnight came and went without the suddenly highly anticipated release, but just around 3:30 a.m. ET, the set appeared on YouTube, trickling to other DSPs shortly after. Swag II was now officially with us. The 23-track set follows in the organic-sounding, warm-feeling alt-R&B mode of the first Swag , with many of the same sonic architects (Dijon, Carter Lang, Mk.gee), and even a couple overlapping feature guests in Lil B and Eddie Benjamin. New to the Swag is Afrobeats star Tems, British singer-songwriter Bakar and ’00s Louisiana rapper Hurricane Chris. But no skits this time ‚Äî Druski makes nary an appearance across the set, although “I’m not the one” and “It’s not clocking to you” references are both made in the album’s lyrics. And the blockbuster sequel closes with the longest Bieber album cut to date: “Story of God,” a nearly eight-minute spoken-word retelling of the Adam and Eve ‚Ä¶

title: Justin Bieber Doubles Down on ‚ÄòSwag II‚Äô: Stream It¬†Now
summary: The pop star's new LP comes just a couple of months after the first Swag dropped in July.
body: Things just got swaggier. In the small hours of Friday morning (Sept. 3), Justin Bieber unleashed new album Swag II with just a short warning. Related Justin Bieber Reveals ‘Swag II’ Album Coming Even Sooner Than You Think Justin Bieber’s ‘Swag II’: All 23 Tracks Ranked Scooter Braun Shares His Opinion on Justin Bieber’s ‘Swag’ Coming just a couple of months after the release of the pop star’s first Swag album, Swag II arrived after Bieber announced its existence via a slew of electronic billboards in different cities on Thursday (Sept. 4). As opposed to Swag ‘s black-and-white visuals featuring photography of the singer and his family, Swag II ‘s color scheme was established as baby pink in the billboards and in posts on Bieber’s Instagram. Disc 1 is the new release, and features 23 new cuts, led off by “Speed Demon,” “Better Man” and “Love Song.” The surprise release of Swag II aligns with the way Bieber dropped Swag , similarly giving fans hardly any heads up before heralding its arrival a few hours prior with electronic advertisements earlier this summer. The a‚Ä¶

title: This YouTube TV discount for existing subscribers is too good to miss
summary: It's essentially 40% off, but only for the first two months, unfortunately.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority YouTube TV is getting a temporary $33 discount for existing users. This brings the cost down to $49.99 a month. You only get the discounted price for two months, but a $66 benefit is better than none. If you‚Äôve switched over from a traditional cable TV, you probably know about virtual providers like YouTube TV, DirecTV, or Hulu. However, if you haven‚Äôt and want to explore cutting ties with a traditional TV operator, YouTube TV could be one of the more beneficial options. The base pack starts at $82.99, which isn‚Äôt cheap but feels justified for the features it offers . And for its existing customers, YouTube TV is introducing a new discount offer that saves $33 per month. Reddit user oestred recently discovered a discount offer that reduces the monthly cost to $49.99, resulting in a $33 monthly savings. However, you must note that the offer applies only for two months, and your subscription costs will revert to the original price from the third month onwards. Despite that, it doesn‚Äôt sound like a bad deal, but you must act quickly, since we don‚Äôt know how long the offer will last.

title: New Era For Australia‚Äôs ARIA¬†Charts
summary: The revamped albums chart, in particular, has a different look.
body: Sabrina Carpenter etches her name in chart history as the first leader on the all-new ARIA Albums Chart , as Man‚Äôs Best Friend roars to No. 1. As previously reported, ARIA, the national labels trade body and charts compiler, undertook a major overhaul to its official chart methodology , the goal of which is to increase visibility for new music and Australian releases, and to invigorate an often-stagnate albums tally. The main change sees titles two years or older moved from the main, weekly charts to a new dedicated catalogue chart, ARIA On Replay. Today‚Äôs the day, and the revamped albums chart, in particular, has a different look . Carpenter‚Äôs Man‚Äôs Best Friend bolts to No. 1, ahead of the soundtrack to Netflix film Kpop Demon Hunters and Stray Kids‚Äô KARMA, respectively. Under the new chart system, the ARIA Albums Chart welcomes 17 new entries and 45 re-entries to the top 100, while only 38 titles from last week appear on this frame.  The changes, ARIA CEO Annabelle Herd explained earlier this year, ‚Äúwill open up space in all the charts for new music and new Australian music.‚Äù She continued, ‚ÄúWhat we think we‚Äôre doing is giving more information to artists, to industry and pe‚Ä¶

title: The best Switch emulator just got a big update, with support for Silksong
summary: Silksong is just the icing on the cake of an otherwise massive update.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority The official stable release 0.0.3 of the Switch emulator Eden is now available. It adds performance updates, driver downloads, UI improvements, and bug fixes. The update also adds support for Hollow Knight: Silksong, which released just yesterday. It‚Äôs been just over a month since the Nintendo Switch emulator Eden dropped the release candidate for version 0.0.3, but after a few rounds of revisions, it‚Äôs finally ready for a stable release. The Yuzu fork adds a ton of new features and improvements, plus improved game compatibility. For starters, the update features a number of Vulkan, JIT, and CMake bug fixes, which should provide a small performance boost on all machines. That includes Windows, Linux, and of course, Android.

title: This new Qi2 25W wireless charger lineup is ready for the Pixel 10 Pro XL and iPhone 17 series
summary: UGREEN's new MagFlow Qi2 25W line includes power banks, wireless charging pads, and multi-device chargers.
body: UGREEN‚Äôs new MagFlow Qi2 25W line of accessories is designed for the Pixel 10 Pro XL and the upcoming iPhone 17 series. The MagFlow Qi2 25W lineup includes a 10,000mAh power bank, a wireless charging pad, and two- and three-in-one charging stations. The Pixel 10 Pro XL supports Qi2 25W wireless charging, while other Pixel 10 models are limited to 15W. All iPhone 17 series phones are expected to feature Qi2 25W wireless charging. One of the biggest highlights of the Pixel 10 series is Pixelsnap , Google‚Äôs branding for Qi2-based magnets baked into the phones. This allows the Pixel 10 series to be used with a wide variety of Qi2 accessories. If you just grabbed a new Pixel 10 series phone and wanted to get a few accessories to complement it, UGREEN has launched its new MagFlow Qi2 25W lineup for faster magnetic charging. Every Pixel 10 model supports Qi2 charging, but there‚Äôs some nuance involved that you should be aware of. The Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and Pixel 10 Pro Fold top out at 15W with Qi2-certified chargers when paired with a 20W or higher USB-C adapter. On the other hand, the Pixel 10 Pro XL steps things up with Qi2.2 support, hitting 25W when used with a Qi2.2-certified ch‚Ä¶

title: The DuRoBo Krono e-reader boasts open Android and a built-in audio player
summary: There's a fresh face in the e-reader crowd.
body: DuRoBo has unveiled its Krono E-Ink tablet at IFA Berlin, calling it an ‚ÄúAI-powered ePaper Focus Hub.‚Äù The device combines a 6.13-inch E-Ink Carta 1200 display (300ppi) with AI note capture, audio playback, and open Android. It is available for Kickstarter pre-sale now for ‚Ç¨279.99, with shipping expected in November 2025. Most e-readers stick to the basics: an E-Ink screen, a bookstore tie-in, and enough battery to survive a long vacation. At IFA 2025, DuRoBo debuted a more ambitious device, the Krono, pitched as an ‚ÄúAI-powered ePaper Focus Hub.‚Äù This is either a mouthful of marketing or a peek at where these types of devices are indeed headed. On paper (pun intended), the specs look solid. The Krono features a 6.13-inch Carta 1200 HD display at 300ppi with an 18:9 aspect ratio. Under the hood, it runs on an octa-core processor with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage, a big jump from the 1GB RAM and 16GB storage you‚Äôll find on most e-readers like a Kindle or Kobo. Powering those beefier internals is a 3,950mAh battery, though DuRoBo hasn‚Äôt shared an actual usage estimate.

title: The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is finally here to put the ROG Xbox Ally in its place
summary: The Legion Go 2 wins on specs, but at what cost?
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority The Lenovo Legion Go 2 is an updated 8.8-inch Windows handheld. Like the ROG Xbox Ally X, it packs a Z2 Extreme chip, but with a better screen and more RAM. Pricing will start at $1,049, with availability starting in October. It‚Äôs been nearly nine months since Lenovo first showed off the Legion Go 2 prototype at CES, but at long last, it‚Äôs finally here to take the spotlight. And boy was it worth it. The updated Windows handheld features top-notch specs across the board. We don‚Äôt have all of the SKUs yet, but the specs announced at IFA today list ‚Äúup to‚Äù the AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme and 32GB of RAM. The ROG Xbox Ally X, which was finally revealed last month , ships with the same chip, but maxes out at 24GB of RAM.

title: Lenovo launches second-gen Legion Go 8.8 with Windows alongside new Android tablets
summary: At IFA 2025, Lenovo is launching its new Legion Go 8.8 gaming handheld with Windows while also debuting some new Android tablets and more. more‚Ä¶

title: Galaxy S26 Ultra dimensions leak, while mockup render reveals welcome curves
summary: Leaked dimensions and a mockup render give us a better idea of what we'll see in January 2026.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority A Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra mockup render gives us a rough idea of what to expect when the phone launches. The image shows off more rounded corners than the S25 Ultra, in line with previous leaks. A leaker also posted the S26 Ultra‚Äôs dimensions, revealing that it‚Äôs slightly taller and wider but thinner than the S25 Ultra. We recently heard that the Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra could have more rounded corners than the Galaxy S25 Ultra . Now, a long-time leaker has given us a better idea of what we should expect. Ice Universe on Twitter has posted a mockup render of the Galaxy S26 Ultra using leaked dimensions (see the first image below). The image also shows more rounded corners than the current Ultra phone.

title: Tame Impala Preps Fifth Album ‚ÄòDeadbeat,‚Äô Shares ‚ÄòLoser‚Äô¬†Single
summary: The Australian psychedelic pop artist and production wizard is lining up his fifth Tame Impala album, "Deadbeat," for an Oct. 17th global release.
body: Kevin Parker is taking the Deadbeat route. The celebrated psychedelic pop artist and production wizard is lining up his fifth Tame Impala album, Deadbeat , for a global release Oct. 17 th — his first through the Sony Music machine. Deadbeat is inspired by the ‚Äúbush doof‚Äù culture of his native, Western Australia rave scene, and recasts his ongoing art project as ‚Äúa kind of future primitive rave act in the process,‚Äù reads a statement. The second taste from Deadbeat is ‚ÄúLoser,‚Äù a track that‚Äôs accompanied with a music video directed by Kristofski and starring Stranger Things ‘ Joe Keery (aka Djo). It‚Äôs the followup to lengthy electronic banger ‚ÄúEnd of Summer,‚Äù which arrived, fully formed, in July of this year. ‚ÄúLoser‚Äù is a departure from those parties in paddock, instead taking us on a magic carpet ride to a funky ‚Äò70s houseparty. And no, it‚Äôs not a cover of Beck‚Äôs self-deprecating classic from 1994. Parker ‚Äúlargely galvanized‚Äù the new album between his hometown of Fremantle and his studio, Wave House in Injidup, WA in the first half of this year. Essentially a one-man band (though Parker takes a full unit on the road), Tame Impala has collected ARIA Awards, APRA Awards, a‚Ä¶

title: Deal: This amazing Samsung curved gaming monitor is $600 off!
summary: I've always wanted one of these amazing Samsung monitors, and now I can afford it!
body: Credit: Samsung via Amazon We reported this deal early last week, but it is so good we‚Äôre surprised it‚Äôs still around. We thought we would send off a PSA to make sure you don‚Äôt miss it! The Samsung Odyssey G95C 49-Inch Curved Gaming Monitor is huge, curved, and comes with great specs. title: The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra $300 off, but only in these two colors
summary: We still think the Galaxy S25 Ultra is the best high-end phone, and it's $300 off today!

These are cool, but if you want true performance and an overall premium experience, you can‚Äôt beat the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra. We would argue it is still Samsung‚Äôs best phone, and you can often catch better deals on it. It‚Äôs currently as cheap as $999.99, which is a $300 discount. Buy the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra for just $999.99 ($300 off)

summary: In the wake of what seems like regular subscription cost increases, YouTube TV appears to be offering some users the chance to get $66 off two months of service, but the discount is hidden. Here‚Äôs where to find it. more‚Ä¶

title: Google is selling limited-edition Pixel 10 merchandise
summary: Besides the actual phones last month, Google started selling limited-edition Pixel 10 merchandise. more‚Ä¶

Mission Updates Science Overview Instruments Highlights Exploration Goals News and Features Multimedia Curiosity Raw Images Images Videos Audio Mosaics More Resources Mars Missions Mars Sample Return Mars Perseverance Rover Mars Curiosity Rover MAVEN Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Mars Odyssey More Mars Missions Mars Home 4 min read Curiosity Blog, Sols 4641-4648: Thinking Outside and Inside the ‚ÄòBoxwork‚Äô NASA‚Äôs Mars rover Curiosity acquired this image using its Left Navigation Camera on Aug. 28, 2025 ‚Äî Sol 4643, or Martian day 4,643 of the Mars Science Laboratory mission ‚Äî at 20:45:52 UTC. NASA/JPL-Caltech Written by Ashley Stroupe, Mission Operations Engineer and Rover Planner at NASA‚Äôs Jet Propulsion Laboratory Earth planning week: Aug. 25, 2025. This week Curiosity has been exploring the boxwork unit, investigating both the ridges and the hollows to better characterize them and understand how they may have formed. We‚Äôve been doing lots of remote science, contact science, and driving in each plan. In addition, we have our standard daily environmental observations to look at dust in the atmosphere. We can stil‚Ä¶

title: Pour one out for the Galaxy Note line as updates come to an end
summary: No Notes.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority Samsung has finally ended software support for the Galaxy Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra. The August 2025 patch was their final update, leaving them on One UI 5.1. Fans say they‚Äôll keep using the phones, but the Note line is now officially over. The Galaxy Note series was iconic in its day, but time waits for no device, and now the last models have finally been cut off. Samsung has stopped supporting the Galaxy Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra, with the August 2025 security patch confirmed as their final update. As spotted on the r/GalaxyNote20 subreddit , the two phones have disappeared from Samsung‚Äôs official update list. That means they‚Äôll remain on Android 13 with One UI 5.1, and owners won‚Äôt see any more monthly or quarterly patches.

title: Pixel 10 teardown reveals new battery removal¬†system
summary: This year, Google publicly focused on the serviceability of the Pixel Watch 4 and Pixel Buds 2a. However, a Pixel 10 teardown reveals a new battery removal mechanism. more‚Ä¶

title: Google‚Äôs Veo 3 lands in Photos, and you don‚Äôt need a $250 plan to try it
summary: You can get a taste of Google‚Äôs powerful video model in Photos' image-to-video feature.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority Google Photos is upgrading its image-to-video tool with the Veo 3 AI model. The update creates four-second, silent clips with free but limited use for most subscribers. AI Pro and AI Ultra users get more generations. Google Photos has been making moves to make your snapshots feel more alive, and the tech giant is about to take things one step further. The app‚Äôs image-to-video feature is getting an upgrade powered by Google‚Äôs latest AI video model, Veo 3 . According to TechCrunch , the rollout is beginning in the US, and you‚Äôll find the feature inside the Photos app‚Äôs Create tab. Until now, the tool has relied on the older Veo 2 model to add subtle motion, or a random effect with an ‚ÄúI‚Äôm feeling lucky‚Äù button. With Veo 3 in place, the results should look sharper and more natural.

title: Nano Banana responsible for 10+ million first-time Gemini app users
summary: Following last week‚Äôs announcement, Google shared today how much of a hit Nano Banana has been for the Gemini app. more‚Ä¶

title: Want the Galaxy S25 FE? This $6 monthly AT&T offer is too good to ignore
summary: AT&T's Galaxy S25 FE deal will help you save some money.
body: AT&T customers can now order the Galaxy S25 FE. Anybody on an unlimited plan can get the phone at $5.99 per month, no trade-in required. The carrier is also offering 50% off Samsung accessories with the purchase of any Samsung connected device. Samsung said it would introduce the latest member of the Galaxy S25 family today and that‚Äôs exactly what it did. The Galaxy S25 FE has officially launched and is up for sale right now, starting at $649. If you‚Äôre an AT&T customer, you‚Äôll be able to save some money on the Fan Edition device with the carrier‚Äôs new deal. If you‚Äôre thinking of picking up the Galaxy S25 FE, AT&T is offering the device for $5.99 per month. Anyone on an unlimited plan can hop on this deal for a savings of 66% ($435). No trade-ins are required to take advantage of this offer. According to the fine print, this deal is for the 128GB model, so you‚Äôll be out of luck if you want the higher storage option.

title: Your old Google phone may be getting this Pixel 9 livestreaming feature
summary: Google‚Äôs Connected Cameras tool appears to be sneaking onto older Pixels.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Pixel‚Äôs Connected Cameras feature is appearing on older models, such as the Pixel 6a, 7, and 8 Pro. Google‚Äôs support page still lists the Pixel 9 series as the only officially supported hosts. The tool lets you use another Pixel or GoPro as a remote camera for livestreams in apps like YouTube and TikTok. Google‚Äôs Connected Cameras feature is handy for turning another Pixel phone or GoPro into a remote camera for livestreams. It was initially billed as a Pixel 9-exclusive feature, but we‚Äôve spotted signs of it starting to appear on older models as well. A Pixel 8 Pro owner on Reddit says they‚Äôre now seeing the Connected Cameras toggle in their settings, and they‚Äôre not alone. In Telegram groups, others report the same on the Pixel 6a and Pixel 7 beta builds. That‚Äôs at odds with Google‚Äôs support page , which still lists the Pixel 9 lineup as the only devices that can host the feature.

title: The brightest Google TV projector so far just debuted at IFA 2025
summary: XIGIMI's new Horizon 20 Max is the brightest Google TV projector you can find right now.
body: XGIMI has unveiled the Horizon 20 Series with Google TV at IFA 2025. The new projector lineup includes the Horizon 20, 20 Pro, and flagship 20 Max with 5,700 ISO lumens. Pre-orders open on September 5 in the US and UK, with shipping beginning in October. XGIMI is turning up the brightness in home entertainment. This afternoon at IFA 2025, the company introduced the Horizon 20 Series, its most luminous projectors yet, featuring Google TV. With this launch, XGIMI sets its sights squarely on home theater heavyweights like Epson and BenQ. The Horizon 20 Series comes in three variants, the Horizon 20, 20 Pro, and flagship 20 Max, but it‚Äôs the Max that steals the spotlight. With 5,700 ISO lumens, it‚Äôs bright enough to hold its own against daylight or a well-lit living room. That puts it ahead of most portable Google TV projectors and even in the same conversation as mid-range home units from brands like Epson.

title: Circle to Search rolling out continuous ‚ÄòScroll and translate,‚Äô coming first to Samsung
summary: Following last week‚Äôs big Google Translate update, Circle to Search on Android is now adding ‚ÄúScroll and translate.‚Äù more‚Ä¶

title: Pixel phones could soon let you set up unique vibrations for each contact (APK teardown)
summary: Your Pixel's vibrations might be becoming more personal.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority We spotted Google Contacts code that hints at contact-specific vibration patterns for Pixel phones. Apple and Samsung already allow you to assign specific haptics to your contacts. If it rolls out, the feature would tell you who‚Äôs calling even when your Pixel is in silent mode. Pixel phones already let you set custom ringtones for individual contacts, but Google could be preparing to take things further. Code hidden in the latest version of the Google Contacts app suggests you‚Äôll eventually be able to assign vibration patterns to specific people, so you‚Äôll know who‚Äôs calling even when your phone‚Äôs in silent mode. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find anywhere else. sign up now By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Use and acknowledge the data practices in our Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe at any time. The discovery comes from version 4.63.22.800982376 of Google Contacts, where we spotted new strings referencing vibration names and‚Ä¶

title: AUKEY‚Äôs new modular wireless charger is an absolute game changer
summary: The Qi2.2-equipped MagFusion Ark comes with detachable spheres that double as a powerbank.
body: The world‚Äôs first modular true wireless charger, AUKEY MagFusion Ark The AUKEY MagFusion Ark is a modular wireless charging system with a Qi2.2 multi-pad base and detachable spheres. Each sphere has a 6,700mAh battery, a Qi2.2 charging pad, and a bi-directional 30W USB-C port, making it a portable power bank. The official launch and pricing are expected in Q1 2026. Multiple base plate and sphere configurations are planned. If you thought wireless chargers were boring, here‚Äôs a new one that is pretty damn interesting. At IFA 2025, AUKEY has unveiled the new MagFusion Ark, a modular wireless charger that leverages Qi2.2 with battery-equipped spheres for the ultimate flexibility. AUKEY MagFusion Ark features The AUKEY MagFusion Ark comprises a base plate with up to three Qi2.2 charging pads, depending on your chosen configuration. On top of each of these pads sits a detachable sphere with its own Qi2.2 charging pad. Every single one of these Qi2.2 charging pads can deliver up to 25W fast charging to compatible smartphones.

title: Anker is ready for your new Pixel 10 with Qi2.2 support in latest charging lineup
summary: Plus some great desktop and mobile solutions perfect for your laptop.
body: Anker is bringing its new Prime models to IFA, with charging solutions from your desk to your bag. The Anker Prime Wireless Charging Station supports full 25W Qi2.2 charging for your Pixel 10 Pro XL. For mobile needs, the Prime Power Bank charges not one, but two laptops at 140W a piece. Keeping our devices powered is the sort of modern-day chore that too many of us tolerate without properly considering all our options, making do with whatever charger we have laying around. That‚Äôs a shame, because accessory manufacturers like Anker have been crafting some increasingly advanced solutions, looking to satisfy our charging needs with speed, flexibility, and convenience. This week at IFA 2025, the company is sharing its latest lineup, including some models ideal for your new Pixel 10 phone. Anker Prime Wireless Charging Station

title: Ecovacs fast-charging X11 ‚ÄòOmnicyclone‚Äô drops the worst part about robot vacuums
summary: Ecovacs didn‚Äôt think robot vacuums and mops were efficient enough, even though they do all the work for you. The Matter-compatible X11 Omnicylcone robot cleaner fast-charges during routine tasks so it never has to stop, and it eliminates one of the most annoying things about robot vacuums ‚Äî dust ba‚Ä¶

title: GaN fast charging is now coming to your‚Ä¶robot vacuum cleaner?
summary: The new ECOVACS DEEBOT X11 can rapidly recharge its battery during short docking cycles for reduced downtime.
body: ECOVACS has launched the DEEBOT X11 at IFA 2025, featuring GaN fast charging technology for reduced downtime. It has an improved mopping system, a new climbing system, and an on-device AI assistant. This new robot vacuum cleaner is available for $1,499.99 from Amazon and other retailers. A high-quality, top-tier robot vacuum cleaner is one of the best upgrades you can make to your house. It dramatically simplifies cleaning routines while saving you a lot of time and effort. But not every home is built the same ‚Äî some of us have larger houses, and a robot vacuum that spends half its time charging up may not serve us that well. ECOVACS is solving for that with the latest DEEBOT X11, which debuts with GaN fast charging so it can spend less time charging and more time cleaning. ECOVACS DEEBOT X11 features At IFA 2025, ECOVACS launched the DEEBOT X11 with GaN fast charging technology. This technology allows the robot vacuum cleaner to rapidly recharge its battery (up to 6% battery in three minutes) during short docking cycles, like mop rinsing. This will be a boon for larger North American homes with complex layouts, as the robot vacuum cleaner will need fewer pauses for lengthy rechar‚Ä¶

title: Govee is ready to put on a smart light show with a couple of industry-first products
summary: Govee has debuted two industry-first lighting products at IFA 2025.
body: Credit: Govee Govee has announced the latest additions to its lighting products. The TV Backlight 3 Pro features what‚Äôs claimed to be an industry-first HDR triple camera for accurate color matching. The Permanent Outdoor Lights Prism also has an industry-first feature ‚Äî a triple color lighting effect with dynamic optical design. IFA 2025 is here, and many of the industry‚Äôs top names are in attendance. Included in the list of presenters is Govee , which has a slate of new smart lighting products to unveil. Among those products are two items that might be industry firsts. Govee TV Backlight 3 Pro One of the big reveals the smart light maker announced today is the Govee TV Backlight 3 Pro. While TV backlights are nothing new, the company says its product is the first in the industry to feature an HDR triple camera. With this setup, Govee claims its color-matching system is able to more accurately capture the colors on your TV screen with its 105db dynamic range.

title: This might be the first mobile hotspot with a 20,000mAh power bank
summary: This new Baseus gadget is a hotspot and 20,000mAh power bank rolled into one.
body: Credit: Baseus Baseus is launching the ‚Äúworld‚Äôs smallest‚Äù detachable AC plug/MagSafe power bank. Additionally, it‚Äôs rolling out the ‚Äúworld‚Äôs first‚Äù MiFi/20,000mAh power bank. IFA 2025 has hit the ground running with keynote addresses and product reveals coming in left and right. If power banks are your thing, mobile accessory brand Baseus has you covered. The company had a couple of announcements for people looking to keep their devices charged. EnerGeek GX11 MiFi Power Bank 20000mAh 67W

title: These new headphones promise up to 100 hours (!) of battery life
summary: You can still get away with an absolutely crazy 65 hours of playback with active noise cancelation enabled.
body: Credit: Baseus Baseus has announced the Inspire XH1 noise canceling headphones. This pair of headphones offers up to 100 hours of battery life, or up to 65 hours with ANC enabled. The company also revealed a pair of wireless earbuds and a pair of open-ear earphones. Baseus has just announced two cool charging gadgets at IFA 2025, including a mobile hotspot that doubles as a 20,000mAh power bank. But the company isn‚Äôt stopping here, as it‚Äôs also announced a trio of audio products today. Inspire XH1 Noise-Cancelling Headphones Starting with the cans (see image at the top of the page), these are known as the Inspire XH1 Noise-Cancelling Headphones. These headphones utilize Bose technology for the sound, which is boosted by support for Dolby Spatial Audio and Hi-Res audio with LDAC.

title: Aukey‚Äôs wild Qi2 charging dock has detachable battery spheres for your Pixel 10
summary: Aukey is launching a new ‚ÄúArk‚Äù charging dock that uses Qi2 and has little orbs that you can detach to charge your phone anywhere, and Pixel 10 owners should be looking forward to it. more‚Ä¶

summary: Philips Hue is launching a huge new product catalog at IFA 2025 this week, with the company‚Äôs new unlocking more device support and features, while the new Philips Hue Essential series offers far more affordable light bulbs. more‚Ä¶

title: Galaxy S26 leak reveals iPhone 17-like design and hints at Qi2 magnets
summary: A new leaked image of the Galaxy S26 series reveals that, finally, Samsung seems to be adopting Qi2 magnets, but also potentially copying the design of Apple‚Äôs upcoming iPhone 17 series. more‚Ä¶

title: I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd like any of these Pixel 10 features, but Google proved me wrong
summary: Credit where it's due, Google knows when a feature is too good to ignore.
body: If I‚Äôm honest, Google made me a little nervous when it introduced the Pixel 10 series . Not because I thought it was about to ruin the things I love about its flagships, but because it seemed like Google was starting to run out of ideas for clever software features. Everything it hung its hat on, from Magic Cue to the Daily Hub, seemed like a careful copy of someone else‚Äôs idea, and it took some of the wind out of my sails. I should have known better. Yes, the Pixel 10 series does have a familiar feature or two from some of its closest Android rivals, but they‚Äôre hardly cheap clones. At this rate, I think Google copying features from Samsung, OnePlus, and Motorola should put everyone else on notice.

title: Philips‚Äô new Hue Bridge Pro can turn your Hue lights into motion sensors
summary: The Hue Bridge Pro comes with Wi-Fi, more memory, and the Hue MotionAware feature.
body: Philips has launched the Hue Bridge Pro, a redesigned Zigbee hub that is faster and more powerful than its predecessor. The new hub supports up to 150 smart lights and 50 accessories and includes Wi-Fi connectivity. The Hue Bridge Pro also introduces Hue MotionAware, which allows existing Hue smart lights to act as motion sensors. The Philips Hue Bridge Pro has been extensively leaked over the past few weeks, and today, the company is finally launching the product. The new Philips Hue Bridge Pro is a complete redesign of Philips‚Äô Zigbee hub and is destined to become a must-have for anyone interested in adding a bunch of Philips Hue smart lights and accessories to their smart home. The new Philips Hue Bridge Pro features an all-black design. It can support up to 150 smart lights and 50 accessories, a vast improvement over its predecessor.

title: I won‚Äôt buy the next Google TV Streamer unless it copies this Acer TV box feature
summary: A second USB-C port or a full-sized USB-A port would be a welcome addition on a future Google TV Streamer.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Colleague C Scott Brown loved the Google TV Streamer , and it‚Äôs easy to see why. The TV box combines a sleek design with plenty of RAM, 32GB of internal storage, Thread support, and a decent processor. However, Acer just announced its own Google TV box in my home market. I quickly realized that if I had to choose between buying a grey-market Google TV Streamer and the Acer box, one omission is keeping me from firmly embracing the Google device.

title: Belkin‚Äôs new Qi2 25W charger looks better for Pixel 10 than Google‚Äôs for the same price
summary: At IFA 2025, Belkin is launching a new Qi2 25W charging puck that‚Äôs perfect for Pixel 10 devices, and has a handy built-in kickstand. more‚Ä¶

title: Google Maps for Wear OS now auto-launches when you need it most, and it‚Äôs a delight [Video]
summary: Google Maps for Wear OS has always been a handy tool, but countless times using it to navigate a city on foot or by bike has often led to a headache for me. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm thrilled that Google Maps for Wear OS now automatically launches, but only when you need it to. more‚Ä¶

title: Roborock already keeps the indoors clean, and now it‚Äôs coming for your lawn
summary: The new RockMow and RockNeo devices join the popular lineup of robotic vacuums.
body: Roborock expands from vacuums to lawnmowers with the RockMow Z1, S1, and RockNeo Q1. The Qrevo Curv 2 Pro is designed to fit in even tight spaces without compromising on power. For the manual approach, the F25 Ultra stick vac taps into the power of steam. Old-fashioned chores are going the way of the dodo, and modern smart home devices are getting better and better at taking care of life‚Äôs little annoyances that we‚Äôd rather just someone (or something) else handle. Roborock already offers an impressive selection of vacuums, from autonomous robotic units to capable stick vacs, and now it‚Äôs not only delivering new options there, but expanding into uncharted territory: robotic lawn care. RockMow Z1, S1, and RockNeo Q1 are tailored to yards of all sizes

title: 5 Android phones you should buy instead of the Google Pixel 10 Pro
summary: I love the Pixel 10 Pro, but these other phones are also worth keeping in mind.
body: The Google Pixel 10 Pro is a darn impressive phone. I‚Äôve been using it for a little while now, and although my review isn‚Äôt quite ready, I can safely say the Pixel 10 Pro is the Android phone I plan on using for the foreseeable future. Its hardware is great, the cameras are unbelievably powerful, and Google‚Äôs software experience is unmatched. The Pixel 10 Pro is just about the perfect Android phone for me, but that doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean it‚Äôs the best Android phone for everyone else. Perhaps you want most of the Pixel 10 Pro‚Äôs features, but at a lower price. Maybe you want a more capable chipset or a more comfortable design.

title: Galaxy S25 FE vs S24 FE: Here‚Äôs why I wouldn‚Äôt upgrade
summary: The two phones are more similar than they are different.
body: It‚Äôs here. Samsung has unveiled the Galaxy S25 FE , a phone that impresses in many ways and serves as an affordable alternative to the more feature-packed Galaxy S25 series . While I believe the phone is a solid purchase, the more important question for many is whether it‚Äôs worth upgrading to from last year‚Äôs Galaxy S24 FE . In short, the answer is no. The days when a yearly smartphone upgrade made sense for most people are long gone. The incremental changes between generations are simply not significant enough to justify the cost. I‚Äôll explain exactly why that is and which phone you should consider buying if you‚Äôre truly fed up with your Galaxy S24 FE.

title: The Galaxy S25 FE is here, but I‚Äôd rather get the Pixel 9a
summary: But the truth is, you can't go wrong with either.
body: The Galaxy S25 FE has arrived, and there‚Äôs a lot to like about it. You get a powerful chipset, premium features like an IP rating and wireless charging, a promised seven years of software support, and a lot more for a starting price of $650. It‚Äôs a phone I‚Äôll often recommend over the next 12 months because the FE series strikes an excellent balance between performance and price. However, it faces stiff competition from the Pixel 9a , Google‚Äôs mid-range phone, which ‚Äî at least for me ‚Äî is a better deal overall. Here‚Äôs why. Pixel 9a vs Galaxy S25 FE: Why I‚Äôd choose the former

title: Samsung DeX finally gets multi-monitor support on the Galaxy Tab S11
summary: Samsung DeX is finally giving us room to expand.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Samsung is rolling out multi-monitor support in Samsung DeX, starting with the Galaxy Tab S11 and One UI 8. Extended Mode allows dragging apps and files between your monitor and tablet display. Launching with the Tab S11, this will reach older Samsung tablets with the One UI 8 update. Samsung DeX is one of the best desktop modes on mobile and has been a useful tool since it was introduced on the Galaxy S8. Samsung overhauled DeX in One UI 8 , basing it on Android 16‚Äôs new Desktop Mode, but there are more new features to come. The Galaxy Tab S11 gives DeX users a long-requested multi-monitor feature.

title: Samsung‚Äôs new DeX drops desktop UI on tablets, and not everyone will be happy
summary: One UI 8 ends full desktop mode on Galaxy tablets ‚Äî unless you're plugged into another screen.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority In One UI 8, Samsung DeX no longer offers the full desktop interface on tablets unless connected to an external display. The updated version improves ease of switching between regular Android and DeX mode without closing apps. When using the standalone tablet view, traditional navigation buttons and quick settings are absent, resulting in a less mouse-friendly experience. Android 16 introduced Google‚Äôs take on a Desktop Mode for Android, and the new version of Samsung DeX is based on it. While some of the changes are welcome , there are some downsides to the latest version of DeX. The Galaxy Tab S11 series gives us our first look at the new DeX on a tablet, and some of these updates might not sit well with everyone.

title: Samsung announces incredibly thin Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra and a smaller Tab S11
summary: At just 5.1mm, the Tab S11 Ultra is the thinnest Galaxy Tab ever.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Samsung has unveiled the Galaxy Tab S11 and the Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra. The Galaxy Tab S11 replaces the Plus model in a more compact form but with similar power to the Ultra. The Ultra has a massive 14.6-inch display and is both thinner and lighter than last year‚Äôs model. Samsung is refreshing its flagship Android tablet lineup today with the introduction of the new Galaxy Tab S11 and Tab S11 Ultra. These tablets come with incremental changes over the previous Galaxy Tab S10 series, and we‚Äôll walk you through all of those. Let‚Äôs start with the immediately apparent change: the naming. With this launch, Samsung is eliminating the Plus variant ‚Äî for now, at least ‚Äî and reviving the standard Galaxy Tab S11, which features a smaller 10.9-inch AMOLED screen with a 2560 x 1600 resolution. A similar lineup rejig is expected of the Galaxy S26 series , where Samsung is likely to eliminate the Galaxy S26 Plus and rename the base Galaxy S26 to S26 Pro.

title: Galaxy Tab S11 revives 11-inch size as S Pen ditches Bluetooth, copies iPad placement
summary: Samsung‚Äôs new Galaxy Tab S11 has arrived with updated specs, the return of an 11-inch size, and some big S Pen changes. more‚Ä¶

title: I pay for Google Gemini, but GPT-5 has convinced me to switch to ChatGPT and here‚Äôs why
summary: I'm not ditching Gemini entirely, but I find myself reaching for ChatGPT more and more often.
body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority ChatGPT has become the Xerox of the AI world, but OpenAI no longer has the stage to itself. Google has been pushing Gemini deeper into its ecosystem, and every few weeks it feels like another rival pops up with promises of being faster, smarter, or more useful. So when the latest GPT-5 model launched last month, it felt like a release OpenAI couldn‚Äôt afford to get wrong. While OpenAI‚Äôs benchmarks claim that GPT-5 is better than the competition, the numbers only tell us half the story. For proof, look no further than the widespread backlash over GPT-5‚Äôs responses at launch. OpenAI was forced to alter the model and make other changes, but more on how that drama unfolded later.

title: This guy made his own slider phone out of a broken Z Flip 5 and BlackBerry keyboard
summary: No folding screen? No problem.
body: A YouTuber attached a BlackBerry Q10 keyboard to a folded Galaxy Z Flip 5 with a broken folding screen. The YouTuber also added a magnetic slider mechanism akin to phones like the Nokia N97. A video shows that the keyboard works in apps like YouTube and in games. What happens if your Galaxy Z Flip ‚Äòs folding screen breaks? Well, you could get it repaired, or you could do what one enterprising person did and attach a BlackBerry keyboard to it. YouTuber and inventor Marcin Plaza decided to attach a BlackBerry Q10 keyboard to a folded Galaxy Z Flip 5 with a broken screen. Plaza even built a satisfying magnetic slider mechanism akin to the Nokia N97, Samsung D500, and other slider phones.

title: Here‚Äôs how you can watch Samsung‚Äôs September ‚ÄòGalaxy Event‚Äô later today
summary: Ready to welcome the latest member in the Galaxy S25 series? Here's what to expect from today's Samsung Galaxy Event.
body: Credit: Samsung Samsung is hosting a Galaxy Event today, unveiling new devices including the Galaxy S25 FE and Galaxy Tab S11 series. The Galaxy S25 FE is expected to bring flagship-adjacent features to a mid-range price point. The Galaxy Tab S11 series will introduce two new high-end tablets with S Pen support and premium specs. In case you didn‚Äôt already know, Samsung is hosting a ‚ÄúGalaxy Event‚Äù today. While it‚Äôs not officially branded as an ‚ÄúUnpacked‚Äù event, the company will still reveal a number of new devices, starting with the Samsung Galaxy S25 FE .

title: Motorola Razr 2025 drops back to its all-time low price of $600
summary: The Motorola Razr 2025 is the cheapest foldable phone we would still recommend, and it is even cheaper today!
body: Motorola Razr (2025) Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Foldable phones are still super cool little engineering feats. I still get pleasant conversations with random strangers when I use mine around town. The thing is, they have been pretty expensive until recently. The Motorola Razr 2025 is honestly the most affordable one that we would still recommend. It‚Äôs usually $699.99, but today the price is even better at $599.99, which happens to be the cheapest it has ever been. Buy the Motorola Razr 2025 for just $599.99 ($100 off)

title: The Ampace Andes 1500 Power Station falls to its record-low price
summary: The price dropped even lower than yesterday!
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority I don‚Äôt like to post deals of the same product two deals in a row, but this one is kind of too good to ignore. Just yesterday, I posted an Ampace Andes 1500 sale , but today it got even better. The power station is at a record-low price of $499, saving you an impressive $900! Buy the Ampace Andes 1500 Power Station for just $499 ($900 off)

title: Hot deal: Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge plummets to new record-low price, saving you $400!
summary: This deal will keep your wallet fat and your pocket thin!
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority The Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge has seen some great deals in its few months in the market (launched in May), but none have been this good. The handset has hit a brand-new record-low price of just $599.99. This means you‚Äôre saving a whopping $400! Buy the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge for just $599.99 ($400 off)

title: Earbud sharing begone: Pixel phones now have proper support for Auracast
summary: Google is joining Xiaomi and Samsung in offering full Auracast support.
body: Credit: Supplied by Google Google has announced that Auracast is now available on recent Pixel phones. This lets you broadcast Bluetooth audio or tune into Bluetooth broadcasts from others. It also comes months after Google introduced Auracast support on Pixels, but only for compatible hearing aids. Google announced Auracast support for the Pixel 9 series earlier this year, but this was initially restricted to compatible hearing aids . Now, the company has announced full-fledged Auracast support for recent Pixel phones . Auracast is part of the Bluetooth LE Audio standard, and this feature allows you to broadcast Bluetooth audio or tune into Bluetooth audio broadcasts from others. This means you don‚Äôt have to give one earbud to a friend if you want to listen to music together, as you can broadcast the audio to multiple pairs of earbuds and headphones. This is also useful for situations like sightseeing, as the guide or establishment can broadcast audio to your existing Bluetooth earphones. Google also points to examples like staying informed at the airport or listening to TV at the gym.

title: Your Pixel Watch is getting true hands-free Google Maps navigation
summary: Start a route on your phone and automatically get full-screen directions on your wrist.
body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority Pixel Watch will now auto-open Google Maps full screen when you start walking or biking directions on your phone. Until now, Maps only appeared as a small arrow notification on your Pixel Watch that required tapping to expand. The update is part of Google‚Äôs latest Pixel Drop, which is rolling out over the coming weeks. If you‚Äôve ever started walking or cycling directions on your phone and squinted at a tiny arrow on your wrist, this one‚Äôs for you. Google Maps on Pixel Watch is being updated so that navigation no longer sits as a small notification you have to tap. It will now expand to the full-screen Maps view on your watch automatically. Google says the change is part of the latest Pixel Drop and will kick in whenever you begin walking or bike navigation on your phone. In other words, start the route on your handset, and your watch jumps straight to the full-screen Maps interface with turn-by-turn guidance, with no extra taps or phone juggling required.
